name: Abeba Haile
description:
'''Abeba Haile''' ({{langx|ti|ኣበባ ሃይለ}}; born August 2, 1970) is a prominent Eritrean singer. She has produced several albums in the [[Tigrinya language]], and can play multiple instruments: traditional kirar, piano, bass guitar, and guitar. Abeba was also a member of the [[Eritrean People's Liberation Front]] (EPLF), a military organization that liberated Eritrea from Ethiopian colonialism. She joined the organization at a young age. 

Abeba has been a highly influential singer, particularly during the 1998–2001 war with Ethiopia, where her music played a significant role in motivating and inspiring the people.
